projects.title: Deadwood Game
projects.description: Worked on a small team of three to implement a digital version of the board game Deadwood. Translated the complex rules and gameplay mechanics of the physical board game into an engaging and functional digital experience. Developed a user-friendly and visually appealing interface using JavaFX, including game boards, player pieces, cards, and interactive components, providing an immersive gaming experience. Added sound effects and animations to enhance the gaming experience and create a dynamic atmosphere.

projects.title: Reel Time
projects.description: Our proposed solution is to create a mobile app that is used to track where and when you catch a fish. The mobile app will take your GPS location and what fish, crab, etc. you catch and then send it to our server which will store all of the data for you to input at the end of the season. Furthermore, as a future stretch goal, we would like to work with local wildlife management facilities and create a way to automatically send in the information at the end of the season so there is no need for user input. Lastly, the user will be able to look at all of the catches they have logged which will be displayed in a list-like fashion.

projects.title: Travelr
projects.description: Led a 5-person team to created a dynamic and user-friendly travel planner. Incorporated various APIs like YelpAPI and GoogleAPI to grab information based on user input. Users can create and delete travel itineraries, including destinations, dates, and activities. Utilized Express and Node.js to build a robust server-side architecture. Employed MongoDB to store user profiles, trip data, and other relevant information, ensuring data persistence and retrieval.
